title: Michael Jackson - Rock With You (Official Video)
description:
"Rock With You" was Michael Jackson's second short film, filmed in 1979 for the second No. 1 hit single from 'Off the Wall.' The Bruce Gowers-directed short film, featuring Michael dancing in a sequined jumpsuit and matching boots against a set of shimmering lasers, was ranked No. 6 on a list of Michael's 20 greatest videos by Rolling Stone.

Written by Rod Temperton
Produced by Quincy Jones for Quincy Jones Productions
From the album Off the Wall, released August 10, 1979
Released as a single November 3, 1979

THE SHORT FILM
Director: Bruce Gowers
Primary Production Location: Los Angeles, California

Although all of Michael Jackson's music videos are referred to as short films, the short films for Off the Wall, Michael's first solo album for Epic Records, are more classic "music videos," as they are performance clips rather than scripted stories.  Michael's short film for "Rock With You" was the second of the three short films produced for recordings from that album. The single reached No. 1 in the United States in 1980, topping Billboard's Hot 100 and Hot R&B Singles charts and reaching No. 4 on Billboard's Year-End Hot 100 chart that same year.

"Rock With You" was certified Gold by the Recording Industry Association of America on February 14, 1980, and Platinum of February 14, 1989. The song was ranked No. 82 on Rolling Stone and MTV's list of the 100 Greatest Pop Songs in 2000. In his 1988 memoir Moonwalk, Michael called "Rock With You," written by Rod Temperton, "the sort of thing I was aiming for" in creating an album to his vision.

The short film featured Michael performing the song on a plain stage in a sequined jumpsuit and matching boots, a set of shimmering lasers illuminating his outfit from behind. Director Bruce Gowers praised Michael as "an absolute professional" in an interview with Rolling Stone. In 2014, the magazine would rank "Rock With You" No. 6 on a list of Michael Jackson's 20 Greatest Videos.

Michael Jackson - "Rock With You" Official Video

The short film for “Rock With You” is a quintessential piece of Michael Jackson's illustrious career, encapsulating the essence of his musical genius and pioneering visual style. Released on November 3, 1979, the video complements the second No. 1 hit single from the album Off the Wall and showcases Michael's formidable talent and unique flair.

A Visual and Musical Masterpiece

Directed by Bruce Gowers, the video sees Michael in a sparkling sequined jumpsuit and matching boots, dancing to the infectious rhythms of "Rock With You." The visuals are simple yet captivating, featuring a stage set against an elaborate backdrop of shimmering lasers that highlight Michael’s dynamic performance. Gowers’ direction focuses entirely on Michael’s energy and charisma, enabling his moves to become the central focus.

The choreography in “Rock With You” is emblematic of Michael's ability to translate rhythm into movement. As the cameras roll, Michael becomes one with the music, his body movements reflecting the song's smooth groove. This performance-centric style of the video marks a significant moment in music video production, emphasizing the artist's presence without relying on a narrative storyline.

Michael Jackson and the Off the Wall Era

The album Off the Wall, Michael Jackson's first solo effort for Epic Records, marked a pivotal moment in pop music history. Released on August 10, 1979, and produced by the legendary Quincy Jones, the album merged pop, funk, R&B, and disco in groundbreaking ways. "Rock With You" remains one of its standout tracks, written by British songwriter Rod Temperton whose work helped define the album's sound.

The collaboration between Quincy Jones and Michael Jackson was a creative joining of forces that propelled them both to new heights. Jones’ production skills coupled with Michael's innovative artistry pushed the boundaries of what pop music could be, and the legacy of this partnership is evident in the enduring popularity of "Rock With You."

Achievements and Legacy

Upon its release, "Rock With You" quickly climbed to the top of the charts, peaking at No. 1 on Billboard's Hot 100 and Hot R&B Singles charts in 1980. Its appeal was universal, resonating strongly with audiences worldwide who were drawn to its danceable beats and Michael's electrifying performance. The song also reached No. 4 on Billboard’s Year-End Hot 100 chart the same year.

The Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) certified the single Gold on February 14, 1980, and later Platinum on February 14, 1989. This accomplishment is a testament to the song's lasting impact and widespread adoration.

Furthermore, "Rock With You" was ranked No. 82 on Rolling Stone and MTV's list of the 100 Greatest Pop Songs in 2000. Rolling Stone praised the video, ranking it No. 6 on their list of Michael Jackson's 20 Greatest Videos in 2014.

An Everlasting Influence

The "Rock With You" video, with its straightforward yet dazzling approach, set a precedent for future music videos. While many artists relied on complex storytelling or elaborate settings, Michael’s focus was always on the music and performance itself. This style choice allowed viewers to connect intimately with his artistry, as every step, turn, and gesture was an extension of the music.

Michael Jackson’s influence on both music and music video production cannot be overstated. His work on “Rock With You” continues to inspire generations of musicians and dancers. It remains a touchstone of originality, demonstrating that sometimes the most striking visuals are ones that highlight pure talent.

The short film is more than just a music video; it's an invitation to dance and enjoy the transformative power of music. Through the elegant simplicity of "Rock With You," Michael Jackson encouraged everyone to let loose and bask in the joy of the moment, crafting not just a video, but an experience that remains timeless.

Conclusion

"Rock With You" captures Michael Jackson in one of his most electrifying forms, solidifying his place as a musical and cultural icon. With Quincy Jones’ masterful production and Rod Temperton’s impeccable songwriting, the song continues to resonate decades after its release. Whether you're discovering it for the first time or revisiting this classic, the magic of "Rock With You" endures.

For more insights and to explore the world of Michael Jackson, follow his official accounts on social media or visit his website. Their links are available in the description of the video. Relive the magic, dance along, and remember the timeless artistry of the one and only King of Pop.
